review: Great place to hang out with some friends. My wife and I love the 2 for $20 menu. It's also great that they have some healthy options on there too. Always fast service and never a long wait for a table.

The worst service we ever had at this local Chili's. My family has been going here since it opened without a problem.  However, today when my husband and I went there for lunch the food was inconsistant with what they usually serve and the service was horrible. Our waitress kept dissapearing and when we finally flagged her down to tell her we were unhappy with our food she gave us attitude. When the food came back out wrong again we asked for the check. We didn't eat our meals, but were still billed full price. To add insult to injury, the waitress came over with our change and lectured us on how we ordered our meal wrong. At no time during our visit was a floor manager visable, let alone available to handle our problem. This resturaunt is close to our home and convenient for a quick bite, but we will never go back.

I've been to other Chili's before, but this one was way below par.  I got a haded a menu that was absolutely filthy and sticky.  The burger I got had no flavor whatsoever.  It just felt like there was no care being taken here.  Really disappointing.  Most likely will not revisit.

It must have been short staffed that day. There was no host at the door so people just walked in and were standing around, we had to go in and ask a waiter to get the host. The silverwear was very dirty and the food wasn't good. I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich and it wasn't grilled, the chicken was white and like it was rushed and not thoroughly cooked. I told them no honey mustard sauce and my bottom bread was saturated with all the sauce leaking out of it. We ordered mild chicken for my little brother and it was covered in hot sauce, it even smelled really spicy. the waitress told us that all the mild wings are made the same way, that would have been useful info to provode when we were ordering and asked for non spicy chicken for a child. We had no choice but to order honey chicken because he couldn't eat that. His food didn't come until we had already finished eating and were ready for the check, then we had to take it to go. I would have been more satisfied going to mcdonalds.

Let me just say that deciding to go to this Chili's earlier this week was probably one of the worst decisions I'd made in months.  My husband and I had our newborn with us and we needed dinner and had an errand to run in the Target next door. We decided to place a To-Go order and then run to Target, pick up our food and go home and eat it. Sounds simple, right? First, I went into the restaurant to grab a menu - there was no hostess at the door. There were two waitresses who were wandering around the restaurant aimlessly. They had the vacant stares of dead hookers. They made no attempt to make contact with me, and I don't think they even went to the handful of tables that were seated.  The bartender looked busy but she didn't acknowledge that I was there either. I waited about 5 minutes, and then reached over the hostess stand and got myself my own menus. I went back to the car, and my husband and I decided what we wanted and he went back in to order for us.  Again, there was no hostess, and when the waitresses saw that he wanted to order, they disappeared into the kitchen. He had to wait for the bartender (who was busy serving a semi-full bar) to place the order. She apparently had called out to the other staff for help and they never came out of the kitchen. It took him about 10 minutes to place the order. Our car was parked near the kitchen window, and I could see about a half dozen people standing back there, snacking, smoking, and chatting.  We went to Target, were gone about 25-30 minutes, and came back to the restaurant.  THEY GAVE OUR ORDER TO SOMEONE ELSE!!!!  We were starving at this point, so we waited for them to re-cook our meal. I would expect that we should get a portion of our meal comp'd for their mishap, but no such deal.  Overall, it took over an hour for us to place our order, wait for the to-go order, and then actually leave with our food.  Which was awful by the way.  We got an appetizer plate with soggy food, my shrimp tacos were full of lettuce and had maybe a total of 4 shrimp between all 3 tacos, and the container was handed to us upside down. So basically I got a salad, some errant shrimp and a soggy burrito wrap in styrofoam. My husband's chicken tacos were essentially in the same sad state. If you are looking to waste your time and your money,, and only get disgusting food, piss poor service, and probably dysentery, then this is the restaurant for you.

Came around 1130 and the place was almost empty, meaning the servers had nothing to do and I'd get fed faster! Chips and salsa were on point, not that you can mess that up, and steak fajitas also hit the spot. As I said before, it was pretty slow and I was checked on multiple times. Way to go Chilis.

I've been here a few times because the food is better than Applebees.  Service is... okay... but it could be better.  I've been here once for dinner (AVOID DINNER TIME!!) and twice for lunch.  I recommend lunch time ONLY.  Dinner time is crazy and the servers are all over the place and ignore you, and then they expect good tips.  ha...   I've never used the restroom, so I can't rate that.

OK... I understand Chili's is a "chain"; but this is not so much about the food, which is adequate at best. This is about the service. We were a party of six.... two of us served, one order incorrect. The waitress disappears. Ten minutes later she brings the balance of the order to our table. One order is incorrect once again. My rice and broccoli are cold... the salmon is hot. Then my drink arrives, which was ordered twenty minutes prior. The waitress disappears once again, then makes an appearance fifteen minutes later. My daughter orders a drink. It never shows until we are ready to leave.  I find this type of service incomprehensible. Doesn't Chili's train their staff? Maybe the waitress was new... if so, she should have had some help. This was a Monday evening, the place wasn't crowded at all. I think management should take a long hard look at their training methods, and hopefully improve this dreadful situation.

I usually get the chicken fajitas everytime I stop in. This time is no different. I like the vibe here. The restaurant is about 4 years old. The staff is friendly.Sadly once our meals arrived, the experience was not fun anymore. My fajitas were warm, not sizzling hot, my wife had the parmesan chicken & shrimp. Her dish was warm, not hot, the cheese covering the chicken wasnt really melted, due to the chicken not being hot enough to melt it. Her broccoli was cold. She spoke with the manager about her plate, she got salmon to replace the shrimp. The manager took the price of her meal off of the bill. That was a plus; however it was still a sad outing. Its amazing how much this place has slipped a lot since it opened. Sadly, we wont be coming back to this particular Chili's in the near future. The vibe alone cant carry a restaurant.

Good overall, great server! Very friendly. Had a smokehouse burger, very good. Potato-bacon-cheese soup was really good but in a tiny cup, for $4.00. I know I only ordered a cup, but this thing was so small. Just a little disappointing, $2.50 would have been more like it for what they serve. At any rate, it was very good and that sort of saved the whole soup experience. Rarely go to Chilis, but stopped off while working on the road. They cooked my burger perfectly (ordered it medium).

We really gave this place a chance, we really did. We've come here multiple times over the last few years. The service was never that great, but the food was decent and it was close to our home, so we went a lot. However, we noticed it really going downhill the last few times in both food and service. Last night was the last straw. First we were seated by a mute host. Then waited 15 minutes to be acknowledged by our server. Half hour wait for the appetizer. Appetizer was brought to someone else's table. Meanwhile was cooling off while they figured out who it belonged to. Tasted old/heat lamp stale. Another long wait for our entrees. My entree tasted like it was days old. Mind you, the place was EMPTY so there was no excuse for the long waits and heat lamp food. Nothing ticks me off more than these places that think their customers should spend their hard-earned paychecks on poor service and poor food. We won't be back, ever.

Really good for a chain. We love the chicken nachos. Very good and fair pricing. Never too crowded and the servers are friendly and attentative.  The beer is cold and the food hot. Its a really good local place to get a bite to eat.
Food is ok but very greasy.  Not as good as it was when it first opened.  Service is hit or miss as well as the food

this place is disgusting!  the baked potato soup was cold and the flat bread was burnt to a crisp.  You could hear our lovely waitress screaming to the cook about our food.  I never send food back but when my soup is ice cold(guess the microwave didn't hear it up fast enough and you the flat bread could be used as a weapon with how hard it is, I would steer clear of this disgusting establishment.

Excellent service most of the time I come here. Food can be timely sometimes, but at least it tastes good, and it's hot. 2 for $20 is a good deal of going with someone else. Ocassionaly you'll have the type of service which is more about when the server gets to go home then the actual customer, but not to often.

Disappointing.  For a franchised chain, Chili's usually offers a decent meal at a fair price.  In this case, the bread on my sandwich was stale, and the chili seemed as if  it had been warmed from another day.   Won't be back.

Went to this place Sunday evening the food was very salty the server was nice friendly but the food was horrible did not enjoy it did not  eat it also my salad was a dirty yes that's right I found dirt in my salad lots of it I can go on and on and on but I won't let's just say I would never go there ever again .

Each time I've dined at this location it's either been awful service, or great service. Every time it's something different. A few times I've gone and found myself standing around for 15 minutes waiting for someone to acknowledge me, even though it was a quiet time. Other times I've sat down immediately, and food arrives quickly. My boyfriend and I came here for dinner one night and he ordered the fish tacos, and there was a huge piece of plastic still wrapped around the fish. The manager came right over, comped his meal and gave us a free appetizer coupon. Turned a bad situation into a not so bad one. Overall I never know what to expect going into this chilis, but I keep coming back anyway because it's close by, the foods decent, and I always get coupons. Lol
We love the chicken and the beef enchiladas they are made in an authentic Mexican way. The service was good and the staff are friendly.

How this place still exists in Delran is a wonder.... SSSSLLLLOOOOOW service is it's premier offering. The only consistency is the hot and cold food both arrive warm! Be happy if you don't get to sit on the toilet during your entire evening back at home. Their famous "baby back, baby back....ribs" suck!!! precooked then buried under sauce so you won't notice how cold they still are from the fridge... There's no such thing as a "HAPPY HOUR" at Chili's you'll have a miserable hour and wished you would have eaten at Taco Bell! HA....HA....I learned over two years ago after several visits....never gonna be better. Wish someone would revive Bennigan's.

Chilli's is one of my favorite places around to eat. I've always had a great experience here with the staff and the food. I always try something new and it never disappoints. I would recommend giving this place a try and their southern smokehouse burger is to die for.
Just ordered takeout. Had the most pathetic looking salad I've ever seen in my life. Looks like they just threw salad and chicken. Only filled up half of the container. Smh

Stop in with a gift card. Beer on tap was cold and they had a decent variety. Husband ordered a burger that he wanted well done, not as well done as he would've liked but he said it was juicy and flavor wasn't bad. I ordered a 3 side combo that included 2 slider burgers that weren't to bad but could have been a little bigger considering the bun. Also got fried pickles the added nice flavor to the burgers but coating didn't stick to well. Third side was chicken fingers that were a bit chewy but the dips they served made up for it. Over all not to bad for a quick bite to eat.

Stopped in with the wife to use a gift card I had laying around. We sat at the bar and about 2 minutes later bartender comes over with menus and ask about drinks. We chose the Sam Adams Winterfest 16 oz. glass, but were also offered choice of 22 oz. glass.  The flavor of the beer went well with our food. I ordered the Southern Smokehouse Bacon Burger well done. Wife ordered the 3 side combo with choice of 2 slider burgers and chicken fingers and side of fried pickles. My burger could have been cooked a little more for my well done taste. But despite that it was very tasty and filling. My wife commented that her slider rolls were a bit oversized for the burgers and her tenders a bit on the soggy side. Time from ordering to food was about 15 minutes. Not bad. Overall for a quick bite not bad, especially when you have a gift card to use.

This is by far the worst place to go out to eat in the state on New Jersey. I've worked in Delran for almost 8 years and have tried to have good experiences here but every, single time I come here, the service is absolutely awful. Tonight when I got here, it took over 25 mins to be seated and get a margarita, which was the whole point of my visit.l, watching the bartender make drinks for people that got there after us. I had to literally get up from my booth, look for a manager, and he himself made the margaritas which I couldn't even drink because it tasted so awful. Not to mention I had expressed a food allergy to my waiter and was brought 3 items that I specifically asked not to have due to my allergy, so had to wait EVEN longer for my food I didn't even want to eat. The food itself wasn't even worth eating but by that point I was so hungry I needed to have something. My friend ordered the shrimp fajitas only to find one being raw and not cooked thoroughly and she stopped eating at that point. The manager was less than helpful and explained it was his first night at the location which was a lie because the last time my friend ate here, he was the manager she had to speak to. He comped our entire meal which didn't do anything to satisfy any of us considering the frustration we had to encounter during the duration of our visit here.  Overall, an absolute disgrace and terrible experience as usual and I hope no one wastes a dime out of their pocket to go to this ridiculously lousy establishment.

I'm not sure why the ratings are low.  I love this place.  Yes its corporate but it's a great place to go.  Never had a bad meal the prices are so good.  Lauren the bartender is so outgoing and awesome. Kaitlyn is great too!! I highly recommend

Well not too good overall. No one in the restaurant . Food was so so. I ordered a lemonade and when it was done I asked for an ice tea instead for a refill and got charged for both!!! One waitress taking care of everyone . Order not correct. Selection of entrees never changes- same stuff each year . Not impressed
Our waitress was really really nice. Our food was out of this world. Loved the fact that we could pay at our seats with the touch screen device instead of waiting for our server

Ordered a take out. Ordered online. Ask for a sunrise burger well done with fries., Texas fries, First sunrise burger was raw. and had no fries with it. Texas fries were cold and hard. When I show up to pick up the order. The girl told me I will get you order together. After standing there for 10 mins. She brings the food out and told me she forgot something. After 10mins more she finally rings my order up. Will not be going back to this location again. Well done means done not raw that you can't eat it.

Used to love chilis, I'm not quite sure what happened but they seem to be going downhill fast... The last 2 times I've been to this location there's been no napkins on the table and you get your silverware in a... wait for it... paper bag? I don't know who came up with that one but the first time I saw it I thought they ran out of napkins or something and then I went back a few months later and yup. Still paper bags lol.. Also I have a problem getting margaritas in plastic mugs.  I know it's chilis it's not some 5 star restaurant but it seems like they don't even care anymore. During my last visit, we were seated and waited for 20 minutes before our waitress even came to the table. Then she apologized to us and told us she was on her break. That's just unacceptable.  Over the years it seems like the quality of the food has gotten much worse as well. I hope chilis makes changes because I really used to enjoy dining there.

I usually like chilis. Not like my favorite place to eat but I'll go every once a while. Went to the one in Delran today. HORRIBLE. We ordered two kids Mac and cheese, Cajun shrimp pasta, and a guacamole burger. My daughters broccoli was literally rotted. The florets were pale and the bottoms were BLACK. Told the waitress and she gave me attitude. Never once did she apologize. I'm a waitress so I get a lot of stuff isn't the servers fault, but if a cook puts rotted broccoli in the window, don't serve it, definitely not to my 6 year old. My sons mashed potatoes were room temperature at best, but it honestly worked out cause he's 1 so he likes his food that way. I ordered Cajun shrimp pasta, I received Cajun chicken pasta. The garlic bread was amazing, and I was honestly heart broken that my 1 year old stole it. The pasta however wasn't even cooked. I even asked my husband to make sure I wasn't crazy, and he agreed, and he usually never agrees with me . So we waited literally 7 minutes to see our waitress again, and I told her, once again came the attitude. That of course was not her fault (besides it being chicken and not shrimp) she told the manager and he took it off. He spent most of the night standing around gossiping about another waitress calling and giving her notice or something, whilst the notice played on her phone the whole time. Never once did he come apologize or acknowledge the raw pasta or rotted broccoli my family received. We will never ever go back. It was one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had. So unfortunate, because it's right by my house. Oh well I guess. On the bright side. My husband loved his guacamole burger. Go figure.

Never going here again! My husband and I have always enjoyed chilis so when we moved across the street we were excited. Well that changed very quickly... after waiting for 30 mins to get our drinks and 1hour and 10 mins to walk out because we still hadn't gotten our food. When we were 30 mins of waiting our waiter came over and the manager on multiple occasions and said " you haven't gotten your food yet let me go find it" after an hour and 10 mins we had had enough and told our waiter that we needed the bill for our drinks that we were leaving he said " I get it it's my last day here obviously you can tell why" that is completely unprofessional.

First time at Chillis in Delran. I ordered a strawberry Marguerite which had too much lime juice in it. I advised the waitress and she said they are pre-made and nothing she could do about it. I had barbecued chicken which was ok. It came with French fries which had way too much salt on them. The only  good thing was the dessert. I would not go there again.
Worst restaurant ever! The people working there need to know they suck. My advice? Do something else for a living. Keeping this place open is a disservice to Humankind. You can't cook.

Everything was perfect. The hots were hot, the colds were cold, and it was all fresh and timely. The chips were even fresh and crispy and perfectly cooked. That's a Chili's first for me!  On a Saturday, no less!  5 Stars!

Upon entering the employees were polite and welcoming. Our waiter Eric was very attentive and engaging. My party ordered the ribs combo, however when it came out the ribs were cold and didn't look appetizing. Our waiter Eric took it back and apologizes for the ribs and bought it to the attention of the manager. The manager apologized and later came back and offered free deserts. Our visit would have been our last, but with Eric's professional service, and the free desert to make up for the cold ribs, I think I would return.

Slow and frustrating. Takes forever to get attention and when you do service is at a turtle's pace.  The manager (Sean) is unhelpful and refuses to make things right.  This place failed to meet my already low expectations and our party was ultimately forced to leave unserved.

This place is awful with awful customer service.  When I walked in my phone was dead and I asked if I could plug in my phone.  The manager Sean informed me there was no place I could plug in my phone.  I then waited at the bar for 20 minutes only to be ignored.  Finally when my running group ended our run there we were refused to be served.  The tip would have been huge for the employees but the manager Sean was awful.  He should be fired.

Chili's I just can't with you anymore.  I.  JUST.  CAN'T.  (I seriously hate that saying, but it applies here and is pretty perfect.)   We haven't been here since my last review, and thought we would give it another shot bc it IS Chili's after all.... certain things are always good on the menu.   But now they've gone and changed the classics.  The fajita's are awful now.  Bland and greasy and I'm pretty sure I ate raw chicken.  The guacamole that comes with it was brown.  BROWN.  Why would you even send that out on a plate?   Hubby sent back the ribs bc he said (I kid you not) "they taste the way a new car smells!"  I tasted them and he was right!  They really do taste like that smell!  It was weird and literally disgusting.  He switched to the chicken fajita's as well, and his guac was also brown.   We were seated in the last booth in the bar area and the manager kinda hung out back there.  He looked at our plates MULTIPLE times.  If he had ever actually come to our table since we DID complain and send food back, he might have noticed the BROWN guac on both plates.  Although, I know he noticed it.  He just didn't care.   Our server was once again the saving grace of the Chili's experience.  She was so sweet and understanding.  But I can't give out stars for this anymore.  When management doesn't even care about guests, it really effects the WHOLE restaurant.

Worst experience at a Chilis to date. Slow and terrible service although they only had one section open. Our waitress came to our table 3 times. To take our drink and appetizer order, to deliver our appetizer and take our food order, and to deliver our food. There was a span of roughly 15-20 minutes between each of those visits that felt like forever which could have been easily remedied with good customer service.  We had to hunt her down to get a refill on water, and she never came to bring us our bill. Had we not been honest people, we could have very easily just up and left without paying. But, we used the kiosk at the table, and left very disgruntled.  Food was cold, but somewhat decent.  Not returning to this location unfortunately.

VERY disappointed . The waitress started out well by taking our order promptly but then it went downhill. After about 30 minutes, we had to track the waitress down for refills on our drinks. At this point we still have not received any of the appetizers that we ordered. There was a group of people who received their food first even though they came in after us . Our food finally came after ONE HOUR and 15 MINUTEs later and it was COLD ! The waitress dropped the food off and left. When she came back she asked "any boxes?" Now why would we want a box for a cold disgusting meal. She kept blaming the mistakes on her "pregnancy brain ". We talked to the manager who only apologized and wouldn't offer us any future coupons or anything else . Will not return to this chillis. VERY unhappy customer as it ruined our night out with friends.
